==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|しん|ぞう|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
From {{m|ja|心|sc=Jpan|tr=shin||heart}} + {{m|ja|臓|sc=Jpan|tr=zō||internal organ}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しんぞう|kyu=心臟}}

# [[heart]] {{gloss|organ}}

====Derived terms====
{{top2}}
* {{l|ja|心臓病}} (''shinzōbyō''): heart trouble
* {{l|ja|心臓部}} (''shinzōbu''): central part
* {{l|ja|心臓麻痺}}, {{l|ja|心臓まひ}} (''shinzō mahi''): cardioplegia
* {{l|ja|心臓移植}} (''shinzō ishoku''): heart transplant
* {{l|ja|心臓移植手術}} (''shinzō ishoku shujutsu''): heart transplant operation
* {{l|ja|心臓発作}} (''shinzō hossa''): heart attack
* {{l|ja|心臓発作する}} (''shinzō hossa suru''): have a heart attack
{{mid2}}
* {{l|ja|心臓外科}} (''shinzō geka''): heart surgery
* {{l|ja|心臓肥大}} (''shinzō hidai''): enlargement of the heart
* {{l|ja|心臓の鼓動}} (''shinzō no kodō''): heartbeat
* {{l|ja|心臓弁膜症}} (''shinzō benmaku-shō''): valvular disease of the heart
* {{l|ja|心臓マッサージ}} (''shinzō massāji''): heart massage
* {{l|ja|人工心臓}} (''jinkō shinzō''): artificial heart
* {{l|ja|スポーツ心臓}} (''supōtsu shinzō''): athlete's heart
{{bottom}}
